intro: Sisymbrium sylvestre, commonly known as wild winter cress, is a biennial or annual plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. The leaves are pinnately divided, with a peppery aroma when crushed, and the plant produces long, slender pods that contain several seeds. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides and in meadows. It is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used historically in herbal remedies.
